intro: Calceolaria tenuis, commonly known as the slender slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Calceolaria tenuis prefers partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and shaded borders.
